item.title: Report E-2023080996
item.description:
Report E-2023080996

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1915 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and swept them in using hand tools. All UN1915-impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then overpacked the damaged 55-gallon drum in one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023080920
item.description:
Report E-2023080920

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 15, 2023, six (6) 1-gallon containers of UN2735 were damaged during loading and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. HES personnel deployed granular absorbents and pads to the release. The crew contained all UN2735-impacted material in two (2) 30-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2023080056
item.description:
Report I-2023080056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: Atlanta
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On American Airlines Flight 980, a passenger came to the aft galley saying'my Vape pod is really really hot to the touch and is Ieaking everywhere". We all jumped into action and as a precaution, used the fire containment bag and followed the directions of our manual and the directions listed on the actual bag itself. We shoved it in the aft galley cart and monitored it for the remainder of the flight. A Manager met the aircraft took the fire containment bag with the vape and talked to the passenger to get information.
